document_data.caption: ''A poor dwarf caught in an earth tremor.''
document_data.name: Earth Tremor
document_data.mainbody:
'''''Earth tremor''''' was an [[evocation]] [[spell]] that caused a brief but violent tremor in the ground around the caster.

{{Quote|Every cave-in is [[Moradin]] telling you to leave the earth where it is.|Halgar.{{Cite MTG|CLB|171|[[earth tremor|Earth Tremor]]|[[Borja Pindado]]}}}}
document_data.Effects: Upon casting ''earth tremor'', the area within {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} of the caster shook violently, damaging and knocking down all creatures that could not brace themselves, except for the caster. Although brief, the intense tremor also uplifted loose [[Earth (element)|earth]] and stone, covering the area with debris that made it difficult to traverse until cleared.
document_data.Components: The spell required only [[Verbal component|verbal]] and [[somatic component]]s.
